original_scene_data.Scene: Mark's Bedroom - Apollo House, Croydon - Early Morning

Dialogue.Stage Direction: 6:47 AM. Mark sits at his IKEA Markus desk chair in M&S boxers and a TM Lewin shirt, anxiously toggling between LinkedIn and his 'Career Crisis Management' spreadsheet on his HP laptop. His MetricShift Digital 'Employee of the Month (August 2023)' certificate hangs askew next to his Dartmouth Business Studies diploma.

Dialogue.Line: God, Steve from accounts has done another 'humbled to announce' post. He's got a Microsoft Excel certification. The man who logged into his own LinkedIn through the company Twitter last month is now officially more qualified than me. The digital revolution is eating its children.
Mark! Mark! The corporate world won't know what hit it! I've mastered the LinkedIn algorithm!
Oh Jesus, he's wearing my interview suit. The suit I wore to three job interviews and one disciplinary hearing. It's like watching a monkey wear the crown jewels.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jeremy bursts in wearing Mark's old M&S suit, accessorized with festival wristbands and a 'Web3 Visionary' pin badge.

Dialogue.Line: How do I look? Professional enough for the MetricShift Innovation Sundowner? I've been practicing my pitch all morning.
That's my interview suit from the Johnson account pitch. It was in the box marked 'Career Emergency Kit - Do Not Touch Under Any Circumstances.'
Yeah, well, desperate times, desperate measures. Super Hans says my sonic optimization concept could be the next mindfulness.

metadata.title: Mark's Anxious Morning: LinkedIn Blues and Suit Misuse
metadata.description: In Mark's bedroom at Apollo House, he sits at his desk early in the morning, visibly anxious as he switches between LinkedIn and his self-titled 'Career Crisis Management' spreadsheet on his laptop. His award and diploma serve as reminders of past achievements now overshadowed by digital skills he lacks. Jeremy enters energetically, wearing Mark's old interview suit, accessorizing it with festival wristbands and a pin, preparing for the MetricShift Innovation Sundowner. Mark is annoyed by Jeremy using his suit from pivotal career moments.

events.title: Mark Corrigan Starts His Day Anxiously
events.description: At 6:47 AM, Mark Corrigan sits at his IKEA Markus desk chair in his bedroom, toggling between LinkedIn and his 'Career Crisis Management' spreadsheet on his HP laptop. He reflects on a LinkedIn post by Steve from accounts, who announced earning a Microsoft Excel certification. Mark is concerned about his career prospects and feels overshadowed by his colleague’s achievements.
key_dialogue: God, Steve from accounts has done another 'humbled to announce' post. He's got a Microsoft Excel certification. The man who logged into his own LinkedIn through the company Twitter last month is now officially more qualified than me. The digital revolution is eating its children.

events.title: Jeremy Usbourne Enthusiastically Enters
events.description: Jeremy Usbourne enters Mark's bedroom, exuberantly announcing his mastery of the LinkedIn algorithm and wearing Mark's old interview suit. He accessorizes it with festival wristbands and a 'Web3 Visionary' pin badge, furthering Mark's dismay. Jeremy asks Mark for his opinion on his appearance for the upcoming MetricShift Innovation Sundowner event.
key_dialogue: Mark! Mark! The corporate world won't know what hit it! I've mastered the LinkedIn algorithm!
How do I look? Professional enough for the MetricShift Innovation Sundowner? I've been practicing my pitch all morning.

events.title: Mark Criticizes Jeremy's Use of His Suit
events.description: Mark expresses his frustration with Jeremy for wearing his suit, describing it as part of his 'Career Emergency Kit'. Jeremy defends his actions by quoting Super Hans and mentioning his 'sonic optimization concept'. Their exchange highlights tensions over personal boundaries and differing career strategies.
key_dialogue: That's my interview suit from the Johnson account pitch. It was in the box marked 'Career Emergency Kit - Do Not Touch Under Any Circumstances.'
Yeah, well, desperate times, desperate measures. Super Hans says my sonic optimization concept could be the next mindfulness.

metadata.title: Mark's Morning Anxieties and Jeremy's Ambitions
metadata.description: In Mark's bedroom at Apollo House early in the morning, Mark is seated at his desk toggling anxiously between LinkedIn and a career management spreadsheet on his laptop. His certificates are hanging askew beside him as he contemplates his professional insecurities. Meanwhile, Jeremy bursts in energetically wearing Mark's old interview suit, accessorized with festival wristbands and a badge, claiming he's mastered the LinkedIn algorithm. Concerned about his friend's antics, Mark recognizes Jeremy's reckless confidence as he prepares for the MetricShift Innovation Sundowner.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: 6:47 AM. Mark sits at his IKEA Markus desk chair in M&S boxers and a TM Lewin shirt, anxiously toggling between LinkedIn and his 'Career Crisis Management' spreadsheet on his HP laptop. His MetricShift Digital 'Employee of the Month (August 2023)' certificate hangs askew next to his Dartmouth Business Studies diploma.

Dialogue.Line: God, Steve from accounts has done another 'humbled to announce' post. He's got a Microsoft Excel certification. The man who logged into his own LinkedIn through the company Twitter last month is now officially more qualified than me. The digital revolution is eating its children.
Mark! Mark! The corporate world won't know what hit it! I've mastered the LinkedIn algorithm!
Oh Jesus, he's wearing my interview suit. The suit I wore to three job interviews and one disciplinary hearing. It's like watching a monkey wear the crown jewels.

metadata.title: Mark's Morning Anxiety and Jeremy's Fashion Faux Pas
metadata.description: In Mark's Bedroom at Apollo House, as the clock reads 6:47 AM, Mark is in his boxer shorts and a shirt, immersed in the tension of comparing himself to colleagues on LinkedIn and managing his career anxieties via a spreadsheet. His attempts at finding solace in his achievements are undermined by the lopsided display of his 'Employee of the Month' certificate. Jeremy, in a playful yet frustrating breach of Mark's personal space, enters wearing Mark's interview suit adorned with festival wristbands, claiming to be ready for the MetricShift Innovation Sundowner. Jeremy's carefree demeanor and bold assumptions starkly contrast with Mark's anxious introspection.

events.title: Mark Contemplates His Career While Checking LinkedIn
events.description: Mark Corrigan sits alone in his bedroom, toggling between LinkedIn and his 'Career Crisis Management' spreadsheet on his HP Laptop. He anxiously reflects on Steve from accounts' latest LinkedIn achievement and his own perceived inadequacies.
key_dialogue: MARK (V/O): God, Steve from accounts has done another 'humbled to announce' post. He's got a Microsoft Excel certification. The man who logged into his own LinkedIn through the company Twitter last month is now officially more qualified than me. The digital revolution is eating its children.

events.title: Jeremy Bursts In Wearing Mark's Interview Suit
events.description: Jeremy Usbourne enters the scene, exuberantly claiming mastery over the LinkedIn algorithm while wearing Mark's M&S suit. He asks for Mark's opinion on his look, aiming for professionalism suitable for the MetricShift Innovation Sundowner.
key_dialogue: JEREMY (O.S.): Mark! Mark! The corporate world won't know what hit it! I've mastered the LinkedIn algorithm!

events.title: Mark and Jeremy Discuss the Suit and Upcoming Event
events.description: Mark expresses his discontent with Jeremy borrowing his suit, which he reserved for career emergencies. Jeremy dismisses his concerns, citing the urgency of his need due to upcoming pitch practice for the MetricShift Innovation Sundowner.
key_dialogue: MARK (V/O): Oh Jesus, he's wearing my interview suit. The suit I wore to three job interviews and one disciplinary hearing. It's like watching a monkey wear the crown jewels.
JEREMY: How do I look? Professional enough for the MetricShift Innovation Sundowner? I've been practicing my pitch all morning.
MARK: That's my interview suit from the Johnson account pitch. It was in the box marked 'Career Emergency Kit - Do Not Touch Under Any Circumstances.'
JEREMY: Yeah, well, desperate times, desperate measures. Super Hans says my sonic optimization concept could be the next mindfulness.

original_scene_data.Scene: Mark's Bedroom - Apollo House, Croydon - Early Morning

Dialogue.Stage Direction: 6:47 AM. Mark sits at his IKEA Markus desk chair in M&S boxers and a TM Lewin shirt, anxiously toggling between LinkedIn and his 'Career Crisis Management' spreadsheet on his HP laptop. His MetricShift Digital 'Employee of the Month (August 2023)' certificate hangs askew next to his Dartmouth Business Studies diploma.

Dialogue.Line: God, Steve from accounts has done another 'humbled to announce' post. He's got a Microsoft Excel certification. The man who logged into his own LinkedIn through the company Twitter last month is now officially more qualified than me. The digital revolution is eating its children.
Mark! Mark! The corporate world won't know what hit it! I've mastered the LinkedIn algorithm!
Oh Jesus, he's wearing my interview suit. The suit I wore to three job interviews and one disciplinary hearing. It's like watching a monkey wear the crown jewels.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jeremy bursts in wearing Mark's old M&S suit, accessorized with festival wristbands and a 'Web3 Visionary' pin badge.

Dialogue.Line: How do I look? Professional enough for the MetricShift Innovation Sundowner? I've been practicing my pitch all morning.
That's my interview suit from the Johnson account pitch. It was in the box marked 'Career Emergency Kit - Do Not Touch Under Any Circumstances.'
Yeah, well, desperate times, desperate measures. Super Hans says my sonic optimization concept could be the next mindfulness.

metadata.title: Mark's Early Morning Anxiety and Jeremy's Bold Pitch Preparations
metadata.description: In the early hours at Mark's Bedroom in Apollo House, Mark sits anxiously at his desk, toggling between LinkedIn and a crisis management spreadsheet. He's in a state of disbelief over a colleague's minor certification. Meanwhile, Jeremy bursts in wearing Mark's treasured interview suit, complete with eccentric accessories, preparing for the MetricShift Innovation Sundowner. Tension arises as Jeremy nonchalantly explains borrowing the suit for his pitch.

events.title: Mark Contemplates LinkedIn Credentials
events.description: Mark sits anxiously at his desk, toggling between LinkedIn and his 'Career Crisis Management' spreadsheet on his HP laptop. He is troubled by Steve's new LinkedIn certification announcement, feeling overshadowed and questioning his own career progress.
key_dialogue: God, Steve from accounts has done another 'humbled to announce' post. He's got a Microsoft Excel certification. The man who logged into his own LinkedIn through the company Twitter last month is now officially more qualified than me. The digital revolution is eating its children.

events.title: Jeremy Bursts In With New Corporate Strategy
events.description: Jeremy enthusiastically enters Mark's room, wearing Mark's old M&S interview suit, adorned with additional festival wristbands and a 'Web3 Visionary' pin badge. He announces his mastery of the LinkedIn algorithm and seeks Mark's opinion on his look for the MetricShift Innovation Sundowner.
key_dialogue: Mark! Mark! The corporate world won't know what hit it! I've mastered the LinkedIn algorithm!
How do I look? Professional enough for the MetricShift Innovation Sundowner? I've been practicing my pitch all morning.

events.title: Mark Confronts Jeremy About the Suit
events.description: Mark confronts Jeremy for wearing his interview suit, which holds personal significance as it was part of his 'Career Emergency Kit'. Jeremy defends his actions, citing Super Hans's advice on his new project.
key_dialogue: That's my interview suit from the Johnson account pitch. It was in the box marked 'Career Emergency Kit - Do Not Touch Under Any Circumstances.'
Yeah, well, desperate times, desperate measures. Super Hans says my sonic optimization concept could be the next mindfulness.

metadata.title: Mark's Morning Anxiety
metadata.description: Early morning in Mark's bedroom at Apollo House. Mark, dressed in boxers and a shirt, is toggling between LinkedIn and managing his career crisis on his HP laptop. Certificates hang on the wall, symbolizing his precarious achievements. Mark's internal monologue reveals his anxiety about a colleague's Excel certification. Jeremy, wearing Mark's interview suit adorned with festival wristbands and a visionary pin, bursts in, excited about an upcoming event, much to Mark's dismay.

events.title: Mark Anxiously Reviews LinkedIn

key_dialogue: God, Steve from accounts has done another 'humbled to announce' post. He's got a Microsoft Excel certification. The man who logged into his own LinkedIn through the company Twitter last month is now officially more qualified than me. The digital revolution is eating its children.

events.title: Jeremy Announces LinkedIn Algorithm Mastery
events.description: Jeremy enters the room, wearing Mark's interview suit with festival wristbands and a 'Web3 Visionary' pin badge. He enthusiastically declares his mastery of the LinkedIn algorithm, causing Mark further distress.
key_dialogue: Mark! Mark! The corporate world won't know what hit it! I've mastered the LinkedIn algorithm!

events.title: Jeremy Seeks Approval for Sundowner Pitch

That's my interview suit from the Johnson account pitch. It was in the box marked 'Career Emergency Kit - Do Not Touch Under Any Circumstances.'
Yeah, well, desperate times, desperate measures. Super Hans says my sonic optimization concept could be the next mindfulness.

agents.name: Mark Corrigan
agents.title: Regional Sales Manager
agents.description: Mark Corrigan is a perpetually anxious yet ambitious individual, holding the position of Regional Sales Manager at MetricShift Digital Solutions. He is troubled by his precarious standing within the corporate hierarchy amid frequent restructures. Despite his attempts at upward mobility, he often feels outpaced by the changing demands of digital transformation. Mark balances his ambition with a looming sense of inadequacy, and while navigating a turbulent personal and professional life, he is often skeptical and rational. He struggles to adapt to the corporate world's preference for style over substance, often feeling overshadowed by his flatmate Jeremy Usbourne.

agents.name: Jeremy Usbourne
agents.description: Jeremy Usbourne is a failed musician and occasional DJ, perpetually 'between projects'. Known for his unconventional approach to work and life, he often uses buzzwords and outlandish concepts to reinvent himself in the corporate world. Previously the frontman of the band 'Momentary Enlightenment,' Jeremy is currently dabbling in the 'sonic arts space', proposing audacious ideas to colleagues and superiors.

agents.name: Charlotte Walsh-Henderson
agents.title: Head of Digital Transformation
agents.description: Charlotte Walsh-Henderson is the Head of Digital Transformation at MetricShift Digital Solutions. A veteran of Silicon Valley with notable burnouts, she represents the new wave of leadership focused on integrating modern corporate culture elements like mindfulness and TikTok references into traditional models. She is known for her openness to innovative and disruptive ideas, seeking ways to transform and modernize workplace productivity.

agents.name: Alan Johnson
agents.title: CEO
agents.description: Alan Johnson is the charismatic and influential CEO of Johnson Dynamic Solutions, known for his ability to pivot struggling companies into successful ventures. Often described as 'The Disruptor Whisperer', Johnson has a keen eye for innovation and values authenticity and rawness in corporate strategies. He is open to disruptive thinking and innovative ideas.

organizations.name: MetricShift Digital Solutions
organizations.description: MetricShift Digital Solutions is a company involved in digital solutions, influenced by corporate restructuring and innovations in workplace productivity. It is potentially merging with Johnson Dynamic Solutions to expand its disruptive influence.

organizations.name: Johnson Dynamic Solutions
organizations.description: Johnson Dynamic Solutions is a company known for pivoting failing startups into successful ventures, potentially merging with MetricShift Digital Solutions to expand its disruptive influence.

locations.name: Mark's Bedroom - Apollo House
locations.description: Located in Croydon, Mark's personal space where he grapples with career anxieties early in the morning. It features an IKEA Markus desk chair and a TM Lewin shirt, indicative of Mark's somewhat conventional taste. The room displays his 'Employee of the Month (August 2023)' certificate hanging askew next to his Dartmouth Business Studies diploma, suggesting both a sense of achievement and a degree of disarray.

locations.name: Living Room - Apollo House
locations.description: The living room in Apollo House where Jeremy practices his pitch. The room is characterized by a cracked mirror and is littered with empty Red Bull cans and printouts of motivational quotes from Gary Vaynerchuk. It's a chaotic space reflecting Jeremy's frantic preparation for the upcoming networking event.

locations.name: Ideation Zone
locations.description: Located on the 14th floor of MetricShift Digital Solutions HQ, the Ideation Zone is transformed for the monthly Innovation Sundowner. This space is meant for creative thinking and is currently decorated with fairy lights that outline whiteboards covered in buzzwords. Kombucha stations, overseen by Charlotte Walsh-Henderson, add to the modern and innovative atmosphere.

locations.name: MetricShift Executive Boardroom - 'The Disruption Chamber'
locations.description: The executive boardroom at MetricShift, rebranded as 'The Disruption Chamber' as part of a controversial initiative led by Charlotte Walsh-Henderson. The space is used for high-level meetings and showcases the company's emphasis on innovative and disruptive corporate culture. It is furnished with high-end Herman Miller furniture, creating a blend of style and comfort for executives and potential partners.

locations.name: The Fox & Goose Pub
locations.description: A cozy corner pub located on Croydon High Street, where Mark and Jeremy sit at a corner table. The ambiance is casual and familiar, typical of a local hangout for winding down with drinks and conversation. The atmosphere is lively enough to allow for interactions without being overly crowded.

objects.name: HP Laptop
objects.description: A laptop that Mark uses to manage his career strategy, marked by its display alternating between LinkedIn and a spreadsheet labeled 'Career Crisis Management'.
objects.purpose: To manage Mark's career and navigate his anxieties related to corporate life.
objects.significance: Embodies Mark's struggle with his professional identity and the pressures of modern corporate competitiveness.

objects.name: MetricShift Employee of the Month Certificate
objects.description: A certificate recognizing Mark as Employee of the Month for August 2023, hung slightly askew on the wall.
objects.purpose: To validate Mark's accomplishments within the unstable corporate environment of MetricShift Digital Solutions.
objects.significance: Reflects Mark's tenuous standing in his company and his constant need for validation.

objects.name: Dartmouth Business Studies Diploma
objects.description: A diploma indicating Mark's completion of a business studies degree from Dartmouth, displayed on his wall.
objects.purpose: To serve as a testament to Mark's formal education and his aspirations for career advancement.
objects.significance: Highlights the clash between Mark's education and the often irrational dynamics of the corporate world.

objects.name: Marks & Spencer Suit
objects.description: Mark's suit, originally purchased for job interviews and significant events, now worn by Jeremy along with festival wristbands and a 'Web3 Visionary' pin badge.
objects.purpose: To provide Jeremy with a professional appearance for the MetricShift Innovation Sundowner.
objects.significance: A symbol of Mark's past aspirations and the absurdity of Jeremy's aspirations in the corporate world.

objects.name: IKEA Markus Chair
objects.description: A desk chair from IKEA that Mark uses while working at his desk.
objects.purpose: To provide Mark with comfort and support while he works at his desk.
objects.significance: Represents Mark's personal workspace and his attempts to control his professional environment.

objects.name: Cracked Mirror
objects.description: A mirror with visible cracks, used by Jeremy to practice his pitch in the living room.
objects.purpose: To allow Jeremy to rehearse his presentation and refine his presentation skills.
objects.significance: Represents Jeremy's fractured professional identity and the fragile nature of his aspirations.

objects.name: Empty Red Bull Cans
objects.description: Multiple empty cans of Red Bull energy drink littering the floor, indicating Jeremy's caffeine consumption.
objects.purpose: To visually depict Jeremy's reliance on energy drinks for focus and energy.
objects.significance: Highlights Jeremy's impulsive and unsustainable lifestyle choices.

objects.name: Printouts of Gary Vaynerchuk Quotes
objects.description: Sheets of paper with inspirational quotes by Gary Vaynerchuk, scattered around the living room.
objects.purpose: To serve as motivational material for Jeremy's entrepreneurial efforts.
objects.significance: Symbolizes Jeremy's superficial approach to business and reliance on popular motivational figures.

objects.name: Networking Emergency Protocols Index Cards
objects.description: Index cards meticulously organized by Mark, containing tips and protocols for networking situations.
objects.purpose: To help Mark prepare and manage networking interactions with structured guidance.
objects.significance: Represents Mark's meticulous nature and anxiety-driven need for control during social interactions.

objects.name: Fairy Lights
objects.description: A series of small decorative fairy lights outlining whiteboards.
objects.purpose: To enhance the ambiance of the 'Ideation Zone' during the Innovation Sundowner event.
objects.significance: Symbolizes the attempt to create an inspiring and creative environment, highlighting the superficial efforts in corporate culture to perform innovation rather than achieve it.

objects.name: Whiteboards
objects.description: Whiteboards covered in corporate buzzwords used for brainstorming and idea generation.
objects.purpose: To serve as surfaces for team collaboration and display of innovative thoughts during the event.
objects.significance: Represents the corporate focus on formalized brainstorming and the emphasis on trendy jargon as part of the innovation process.

objects.name: Kombucha Stations
objects.description: Designated areas set up with kombucha drinks for attendees.
objects.purpose: To offer trendy, health-conscious drink options at the Innovation Sundowner.
objects.significance: Illustrates the blend of wellness and corporate culture, and the pursuit of modernity and trendiness in workplace environments.

objects.name: Fruit-Infused Water Station
objects.description: A station providing water infused with fresh fruits.
objects.purpose: To offer a refreshing drink option for attendees while contributing to the wellness ethos.
objects.significance: Emphasizes the corporate wellness trend and the attempt to portray a progressive and health-oriented company culture.

objects.name: LinkedIn Premium Name Badge
objects.description: A name badge denoting a user's LinkedIn Premium status worn by Mark.
objects.purpose: To provide identification and signify professional networking capability.
objects.significance: Highlights Mark's need to demonstrate his professional engagement and status amidst corporate anxiety.

objects.name: DJ Equipment
objects.description: A set of DJ equipment borrowed from Super Hans' failed silent disco business, featuring components suited for electronic music performances.
objects.purpose: To create and play a 'scientifically-engineered productivity soundscape' during Jeremy's presentation.
objects.significance: Symbolizes Jeremy's unconventional approach and the unexpected success of his impromptu pitch, leading to potential corporate opportunities for him.

objects.name: MetricShift Lanyard
objects.description: A lanyard bearing the MetricShift logo, inexplicably worn by Super Hans in a casual pub setting.
objects.purpose: To signify Super Hans's unexpected involvement or connection with MetricShift.
objects.significance: Symbolizes the blurring boundaries between professional and personal identities and the infiltration of corporate culture into casual life.

objects.name: LinkedIn Notification
objects.description: A notification on Mark's phone indicating an endorsement Steven from accounts has given Jeremy for skills in 'Digital Transformation' and 'Change Management'.
objects.purpose: To update Mark on Jeremy's growing professional network and perceived skills.
objects.significance: Highlights the irony of Jeremy's rise in the corporate world based on superficial achievements and the social validation attached to online endorsements.
